1.verse: Chapter 1 -Jerusalem Deserted and Forsaken -How deserted now is the citythat was formerly overflowing with people!Once she was the greatest of the nations;now she is like a widow.Once she was a princess among the provinces;now she is subjected to forced labor.

2.verse: She weeps bitterly throughout the night,with tears running down her cheeks.Not a single one of those who loved herremains to offer her comfort.All of her friends have betrayed herand have become her enemies.

3.verse: After enduring intense suffering and endless servitude,Judah has gone into exile.She lives among the nationsbut finds no resting place.In the midst of her distressher persecutors have overtaken her.

4.verse: The roads to Zion mourn,for no pilgrims now come to her festivals.All of her gateways are deserted;her priests groan,her young maidens are grief-strickenand their fate is bitter.

5.verse: Her foes have become her masters,and her enemies prosper,for the Lord has made her sufferfor her endless transgressions.Her children are no longer there,having been taken captive by their oppressor.

6.verse: Every vestige of splendorhas departed from the daughter of Zion.Her princes have become like stagsthat can find no pasture;with their strength exhaustedthey flee before their pursuers.

7.verse: In the days of her misery and distressJerusalem will remember those timeswhen her people were overcome by the enemy,and she had no one to help her.Her foes mocked her unceasinglyand laughed over her downfall.

8.verse: Because Jerusalem had sinned so grievously,she was regarded as an object of defilement.All those who honored her now despise herafter having beheld her nakedness.She herself groans in anguishand turns her face away.

9.verse: Her filthiness befouled her skirts;she gave no thought to her future.Her downfall was incredible,and there was no one to comfort her.“O Lord, look at my affliction,for the enemy has triumphed.”

10.verse: The enemy stretched out their handsto seize all her treasures.She beheld the nationsinvade her sanctuary,those whom you had forbiddento come into your assembly.

11.verse: All her people groanas they desperately search for bread.They trade their treasures for foodto keep themselves alive.Look, O Lord, and seehow worthless I have become.

12.verse: All of you who pass this way,look and see.Is there any sorrow like the sorrowthat has been inflicted upon mewhich the Lord forced me to sufferon the day of his fierce anger?

13.verse: From on high he sent down firethat lodged deep in my bones.He spread a net for my feetand turned me back.He left me desolateand in a state of weakness all day long.

14.verse: My sins have been bound into a yoke,woven together by his hand.They weigh down my neckand sap my strength.The Lord has handed me overto those whom I cannot withstand.

15.verse: The Lord has totally rejectedall the warriors in my midst,and he has summoned an army against meto crush my young warriors.The Lord has trodden in the winepressthe virgin daughter of Judah.

16.verse: This is why I weepand my eyes flow with tears.Anyone who could comfort and strengthen meis far from my presence.My children are desolate,for the enemy has prevailed.

17.verse: Zion stretches out her handsbut there is no one to comfort herThe Lord has commanded the neighbors of Jacobto become his enemies.In their midst Jerusalem has becomean unclean thing to be avoided.

18.verse: The Lord has acted justly,for I rebelled against his command.Listen, all you peoples,and behold my suffering.My maidens and my youthshave been taken into captivity.

19.verse: I called out to my alliesbut they failed me.My priests and my eldersperished in the citywhere they searched for foodto keep themselves alive.

20.verse: Behold, O Lord, how great is my distress.My inner being is in turmoil.My heart recoils within mebecause I have been so rebellious.In the streets the sword causes bereavement;in the houses death reigns.

21.verse: People have heard my groans,but no one has offered to comfort me.All my enemies have learned of my troubles,and they are pleased at what you have done.Hasten the day you have proclaimedso that they may become like me.

22.verse: Let all their wicked deeds come before you,and deal with themas you have dealt with mebecause of all my sins.My groans never cease,and I am sick at heart.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -The Judgment of the Lord -Behold how the Lord in his angerhas enveloped in darkness the daughter of Zion.He has hurled down from heaven to earththe glory of Israel,without any sign of regard for his footstoolon the day of his anger.

2.verse: Without mercy, the Lord has destroyedall the dwellings of Jacob.In his wrath he has torn downthe fortresses of the daughter of Judah.He has thrown to the ground in dishonorthe kingdom and its rulers.

3.verse: In his fierce anger he broke offall the strength of Israel.He withdrew the protection of his right handat the approach of the enemy.He blazed against Jacob like a flaming firethat consumes everything in its path.

4.verse: Like an enemy he bent his bow,with his right hand prepared for action.Like a foe he slew all thosein whom he once took great pride.He poured forth his fury like fireover the tent of the daughter of Zion.

5.verse: The Lord has become an enemy;he has annihilated Israel.He has destroyed all its palacesand left all its strongholds in ruins.For the daughter of Judahhe has multiplied mourning and lamentation.

6.verse: He has laid waste his dwelling like a gardenand destroyed his tabernacle.The Lord has erased in Zionevery memory of festivals and Sabbaths.In his fierce anger he has treated with contemptking and priest alike.

7.verse: The Lord has rejected his altarand abandoned his sanctuary.He has delivered the walls of her palacesinto the power of the enemywho raised a clamor in the house of the Lordas on a festival day.

8.verse: The Lord was determined to destroythe walls of the daughter of Zion.He marked off its boundaries with a measuring lineand did not relent in his purpose.He caused both wall and rampart to lament;together they crumbled to the ground.

9.verse: The bars of her gates have been shattered,and the gates themselves have sunk into the ground.Her king and her princes are in exile among the Gentiles;there is no instruction any longer from priests,and her prophets have not receivedany vision from the Lord.

10.verse: The elders of the daughter of Zionsit on the ground in silence.They have strewn dust on their headsand wrapped themselves in sackcloth.The maidens of Jerusalembow their heads to the ground.

11.verse: My eyes are exhausted from weeping,and torment afflicts my innermost being.My gall is poured out on the earthbecause of the destruction of my people,as children and infants faintin the streets of the city.

12.verse: They keep crying out to their mothers,“Where is there bread and something to drink?”as they faint like the woundedin the streets of the city,and breathe their lastin their mothers’ arms.

13.verse: To what can I liken you or compare you,O daughter of Jerusalem?What can I do to rescue and comfort you,O virgin daughter of Zion?Your ruin is as vast as the sea.Who can heal you?

14.verse: The visions that your prophets revealed to youwere false and worthless.They did not lay bare your guiltso that you might reverse your fortunes.The visions they proclaimed to youwere erroneous and deceptive.

15.verse: All those who pass byclap their hands at you.They hiss and wag their headsat the daughter of Jerusalem,“Is this the city once described as perfect in beauty,the joy of the whole world?”

16.verse: All your enemies do not hesitateto open their mouths against you.They hiss and gnash their teeth;they cry out, “We have devoured her!This is the day we longed for;at last we have seen it.”

17.verse: The Lord has done what he planned;he has carried out his threat.As he decreed from days of old,he has destroyed without pity.He has permitted the enemy to rejoice over youand exalted the strength of your foes.

18.verse: Cry out to the Lord,O wall of the daughter of Zion.Let your tears flow like a torrentboth day and night.Allow yourself no respite;give your eyes no rest.

19.verse: Arise and cry out during the nightat the beginning of every watch.Pour out your heart like waterin the presence of the Lord.Lift up your hands to himfor the lives of your childrenwho are fainting from hungerat the corner of every street.

20.verse: Look, O Lord, and consider:whom have you ever treated in this fashion?Should women eat their little ones,the children to whom they gave birth?Should priest and prophet be killedin the sanctuary of the Lord?

21.verse: The young and the old are lying deadon the ground in the streets.My young women and my young menhave fallen by the sword.On the day of your anger you have slain them,slaughtering them without pity.

22.verse: As if it were for a day of festival,you summoned my enemies from every side.On the day of the Lord’s angerno one escaped and no one survived.All those whom I bore and rearedmy enemy has completely annihilated.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -The Enduring Love of the Lord -I am a man who has known afflictionunder the rod of God’s wrath.

2.verse: He has led me and forced me to walkin darkness, not in the light.

3.verse: Against me alone he has turned his handagain and again, throughout the day.

4.verse: He has caused my flesh and my skin to waste away;he has broken my bones.

5.verse: He has besieged me and enveloped mewith bitterness and hardship.

6.verse: He has forced me to dwell in darknesslike those long dead.

7.verse: He has walled me in so that I cannot escape,and he weighed me down with heavy chains.

8.verse: Even when I cry out and plead for help,he shuts out my prayer.

9.verse: He has barred my way with blocks of stonesand obstructed my paths.

10.verse: He has been for me a bear lying in waitor a lion hiding in ambush.

11.verse: He has led me away and torn me to pieces,leaving me helpless.

12.verse: He has bent his bow and used meas the target for his arrows.

13.verse: He has pierced deep within mewith the shafts from his quiver.

14.verse: I have become a laughingstock to my people;they taunt me in song throughout the day.

15.verse: He has given me my fill of bitter herbsand sated me with wormwood.

16.verse: He has broken my teeth with graveland trampled my face into the dust.

17.verse: My soul is deprived of peace;I no longer remember what happiness is.

18.verse: Thus I cry out that my glory is goneas well as everything that I had hoped for from the Lord.

19.verse: The realization of my poverty and homelessnessis wormwood and gall to me.

20.verse: My soul continually reflects on thisand is left downcast within me.

21.verse: However, I will call this to mindas the reason for my hope:

22.verse: The love of the Lord is never exhausted,nor do his deeds of mercy ever come to an end.

23.verse: They are renewed every morning;his faithfulness never ceases.

24.verse: The Lord is my portion, I say to myself;therefore, I will place my hope in him.

25.verse: The Lord is good to those who wait for him,to the soul that seeks him.

26.verse: It is good to wait in silencefor the salvation of the Lord.

27.verse: It is good for a man to bearthe yoke from his youth.

28.verse: Let that man sit alone and in silencewhen the yoke is laid upon him.

29.verse: Let him bury his head in the dust;there may still be hope.

30.verse: Let him offer his cheek to those who strike himand endure their insults.

31.verse: For the rejection by the Lordwill not last forever.

32.verse: Even though he punishes, he will be compassionatein the abundance of his unfailing love.

33.verse: For he does not willingly afflictor cause grief to the children of men.

34.verse: When all the prisoners in a countryare trampled underfoot,

35.verse: when human rights are pervertedin defiance of the Most High,

36.verse: when someone is deprived of justice in the courts—is the Lord not aware of such evils?

37.verse: Who has only to command and it is doneif the Lord has not given his approval?

38.verse: Is it not from the mouth of the Most Highthat evil and good proceed?

39.verse: Why then should any people complainabout being punished for their sins?

40.verse: Let us examine and test our waysand return to the Lord.

41.verse: Let us lift up our hearts and our handsto God in heaven.

42.verse: We have sinned and rebelled,and you have not forgiven us.

43.verse: You have veiled yourself in anger and pursued us,slaying us without pity.

44.verse: You have wrapped yourself in a cloudthat no prayer can pierce.

45.verse: You have reduced us to filthand rubbish among the nations.

46.verse: All of our enemies have opened their mouthsin a chorus of jeers against us.

47.verse: Terror and pitfall, devastation and ruin,have been our lot.

48.verse: My eyes flow with a torrent of tearsbecause of the destruction of my people.

49.verse: My eyes will flow with unceasing tears,and there will be no respite

50.verse: until the Lord from heavenlooks down and sees.

51.verse: My eyes are swollen with griefat the fate of all the daughters of my city.

52.verse: Those who were my enemies without justificationhave hunted me down like a bird.

53.verse: They thrust me alive into a pitand hurled down stones at me.

54.verse: The waters rose above my head,and I said, “I am lost.”

55.verse: I called upon your name, O Lord,from the depths of the pit.

56.verse: You heard me plead,“Do not close your ear to my cry for help!”

57.verse: You came near when I called out to you,and you said, “Do not fear.”

58.verse: O Lord, you have taken up my cause,and you have redeemed my life.

59.verse: You have seen the unjust treatment I endure;grant me justice.

60.verse: You have seen all their vindictiveness,all their plots against me.

61.verse: You have heard their insults, O Lord;all their plots against me,

62.verse: the whispers and murmuring of my foesagainst me all day long.

63.verse: Whether they sit or stand,see how I am the object of their taunts.

64.verse: Pay them back for their deeds, O Lord;punish them as they deserve.

65.verse: Give them hardness of heartas your curse upon them.

66.verse: Pursue them in anger and destroy themfrom under your heavens, O Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -The Punishment of the Prophet and People -How the gold has become tarnished,how the pure gold has lost its luster!The sacred stones lie scatteredat every street corner.

2.verse: The precious sons of Zionwere formerly worth their weight in gold.Now they are reckoned as no more valuablethan clay jars fashioned by a potter.

3.verse: Even jackals bare their breastsand nurse their young.But the daughters of my people have becomeas cruel as ostriches in the desert.

4.verse: The tongue of an infantsticks to the roof of its mouth in thirst.Little children beg for bread,but no one offers them a crumb.

5.verse: Those who once feasted on delicaciesnow lie dying in the streets.Those who once wore purple garmentsnow grovel in rubbish heaps.

6.verse: The punishment inflicted on my peoplehas been greater than that of Sodom,which was overthrown in an instantwithout a hand being lifted to help her.

7.verse: Her princes were once brighter than snowand whiter than milk.Their bodies were more ruddy than coral,more precious than sapphire.

8.verse: Now their faces are blacker than soot,and no one recognizes them in the streets.Their skin has shriveled tightly over their bones,as dry as a stick.

9.verse: More blessed were those who died by the swordthan those who died of hunger,with their limbs wasting away,deprived of the produce of the field.

10.verse: With their own hands, compassionate womenhave boiled their own children;those offspring became their foodwhen my people were on the verge of extinction,

11.verse: The Lord let his blazing anger pour forthand gave full vent to his wrathas he kindled a fire in Zionthat devoured her foundations.

12.verse: The kings of the earth never believed,nor did any of the inhabitants of the world,that any adversary or enemycould ever penetrate the gates of Jerusalem.

13.verse: That occurred because of the sins of her prophetsand the crimes of her priestswho had shed within her wallsthe blood of the righteous.

14.verse: They staggered blindly in the streets,so defiled with bloodthat not one of the people daredto touch their garments.

15.verse: “Go away! You are unclean!” the people shouted.“Keep away! Do not touch us!”Wherever they fled, the people would cry out,“You cannot stay here any longer!”

16.verse: The Lord himself scattered them;he no longer watches over them.He showed no favor to the priestsor kindness to the elders.

17.verse: Continually we strained our eyes,looking in vain for help.From our towers we watched endlesslyfor a nation that could not save us.

18.verse: Men dogged our stepsso that we were unable to walk in our streets.Our end drew near; our days were numbered;our time had come.

19.verse: Our pursuers were swifterthan eagles in the heavens.They hounded us over the mountainsand lay in ambush for us in the wilderness.

20.verse: The Lord’s anointed, our breath of life,was caught in their traps,he in whose shadow we thoughtthat we could live in safety among the nations.

21.verse: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,you who live in the land of Uz.But to you also the cup will be passed;you will become drunk and strip yourself naked.

22.verse: O daughter of Zion, your punishment is now complete;he will not prolong your exile.But, daughter of Edom, he will punish your iniquity,and he will lay bare your sins.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -The Prophet’s Plea for Mercy -Remember, O Lord, what has befallen uslook, and see our disgrace.

2.verse: Our inherited lands have been given to strangers,our homes to foreigners.

3.verse: We have become orphans and fatherless;our mothers are like widows.

4.verse: We must purchase the water we drink;we must pay for our own wood.

5.verse: On our necks is the yoke of those who persecute us;although we are exhausted, we are afforded no rest.

6.verse: We have submitted to Egypt and Assyriato get enough bread to sustain us.

7.verse: Our ancestors who sinned are no longer alive,but we bear the burden of their guilt.

8.verse: Slaves have become our rulers;there is no one to deliver us from their hands.

9.verse: We earn our bread at the peril of our livesbecause of the sword in the wilderness.

10.verse: Our skin is blackened as in a furnacefrom the scorching heat of famine.

11.verse: Women have been raped in Zionand virgins in the towns of Judah.

12.verse: Princes have been hung up by their hands;elders are shown no respect.

13.verse: Young men toil, carrying the millstones;boys stagger under their loads of wood.

14.verse: The old men no longer assemble at the city gate;the young men have given up their music.

15.verse: Joy has vanished from our hearts;our dancing has turned to mourning.

16.verse: The garlands have fallen from our heads;woe to us, for we have sinned.

17.verse: This is why we are sick at heart;because of this our eyes have grown dim.

18.verse: Mount Zion lies desolate,overrun with jackals.

19.verse: But you, O Lord, reign forever;your throne endures from age to age.

20.verse: Why have you ceased to remember us?Why have you abandoned us for so long a time?

21.verse: Restore us back to you, O Lord, and we will return.Renew our days as we had of old,

22.verse: unless you have utterly rejected uswith an anger that is beyond measure.
